The trees would find nutrients more quickly by searching out sunlit areas and growing in that direction.
Trees might grow in unintuitive ways, such as around rocky areas.
The trees might find other organisms to eat, such as other plants or animals.

Trees could also nutrients from each other via root fusion or fungi networks. This would allow them to reach more nutrients faster and possibly even help one another by sharing nutrients if one tree was not able find.
In some cases, trees might even compete for resources, resulting in the death of some trees and the growth of new ones.
